title: The Best Coding Tricks For Beginners
summary: You don’t need to know everything about coding before you even begin. You can start with a simple application like a calculator that asks you to type in mathematical equations like 2+3 to find out the answer of 5+3. The best way to find and fix errors in your code is to use a debugger. Use for-loops when you’re working with arrays or collections because they are easier and more efficient than if-else statements. Use conditionals when making decisions based on certain values.

content.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Read and understand the basics before you dive in."),mdx("p",null,`Before you even touch a keyboard, you need to make sure you understand the basics of coding. What is a variable? How do you use comments? What\u2019s a Boolean? You\u2019ll also need to understand the principles of logic gates and Boolean logic gates if you want to understand how computers work.
The good news is that you don\u2019t need to know everything about coding before you even begin. You can start with a simple application like a calculator that asks you to type in mathematical equations like 2+3 to find out the answer of 5.
You can also start with a program that allows you to create simple animations and graphics. These types of programs are excellent for beginners as they don\u2019t require any knowledge of complex coding languages. Once you feel more confident and comfortable with the basics, you can move on to more heavy duty applications that require more advanced coding skills.`),mdx("h2",null,"Use a code debugger to fix errors."),mdx("p",null,`Every programmer makes mistakes, and if you\u2019re just getting started you\u2019re bound to make a few. But don\u2019t worry, it\u2019s completely normal.
The best way to find and fix errors in your code is to use a debugger. A debugger is a program that helps you work out where an error has occurred by allowing you to \u201Cpause\u201D and \u201Crewind\u201D your code so you can see what it\u2019s doing and where it\u2019s going wrong.
You should be able to find debuggers for any programming language you\u2019re using online. If you\u2019re having difficulties, it\u2019s a great idea to ask other coders on online forums for advice. They\u2019ll likely be happy to help.`),mdx("h2",null,"Don\u2019t be afraid to use comments when necessary."),mdx("p",null,`Humans are much better at reading plain English, than trying to decipher someone\u2019s code. This is the reason why you should always comment your code. Commenting your code makes it much more readable and easy to follow, even for other coders.
You should always comment the purpose of your code and what it does, as well as why you\u2019ve done it a certain way. This shows that you\u2019ve thought about your code and what it does, and will make it much easier for other people to use your code and update it at a later date.
You should also comment if you\u2019re using a complex piece of code to save yourself from having to re-write it in the future if you need to, or if you\u2019re sharing your code with other people.`),mdx("h2",null,"Try utilising conditionals when making decisions."),mdx("p",null,`This is a commonly used programming technique that allows you to make decisions based on certain values.
For example, if you\u2019re making a game, you might want to use a conditional to check if the player has three lives left so they get the option to continue playing the game.
If you\u2019re building a website, you might want to use a conditional to see if a visitor is using an Apple device or a PC device so that you know which button to show them.
Conditionals should be used in pretty much every application you create, as they are an extremely efficient and useful way of programming.
Make sure you understand the difference between if-then statements and switch statements. If-then statements essentially check one variable and switch statements check for multiple variables.`),mdx("h2",null,"Use for-loops when working with arrays or collections."),mdx("p",null,`An array is essentially a list of values that you store under one variable name. For example, you could have an array that stores your favorite colours. You could have an array with the colours red, blue and green under the variable name \u201CColours.\u201D
You can then access and manipulate these values as if they were stored under different variables, which they effectively are.
You should use for-loops when you\u2019re working with arrays or collections because they are much easier and more efficient than if-then-else statements.
For example, if you\u2019re trying to find out the highest number in a collection of numbers by adding them up, with a for-loop you can simply type in the name of the array plus the word \u201Cmax.\u201D`),mdx("h2",null,"Be careful when using switch cases."),mdx("p",null,`Switch cases are perhaps one of the most commonly used programming techniques. You can use them to compare values or perform actions based on a value.
For example, if you\u2019re building a game and want to figure out how many points a player has, you can use a switch case to compare the number of points they have against a set number to find out how many points the player has.`),mdx("p",null,`Switch cases are extremely useful and are one of the most commonly used programming techniques. However, it\u2019s important to remember that you should only use them when a conditional isn\u2019t necessary.
Switch cases are good for comparing values or performing actions based on a value, but they aren\u2019t good when you want to check if a value is true or false. You should use if-then statements when you want to check if something is true or false.`),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"Coding is a skill that's useful for many careers, and there are many ways to learn. While each person is different, there are a few tips that can help beginners get started. Once you understand these principles your code will become more readable and logical, and your programs will run more efficiently."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:a,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:a,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`There are a number of programming languages available for creating databases. You can create a database using simple file-based formats or you can use more advanced options such as object-oriented database management systems (ODBMS) or graph database management systems. Depending on what type of database you want to create and your specific needs, there is likely an ideal programming language for you.
The Go programming language is one option that is worth exploring if you are looking for a great general-purpose programming language but one with special focus on database programming. Many programmers value Go\u2019s simple syntax, its special built-in support for strings and its powerful built-in concurrency primitives. If you\u2019d like to learn more about this programming language and whether it\u2019s the right option for creating databases, continue reading to discover everything you need to know about Go and databases.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Are you looking for a way to develop your child\u2019s critical thinking skills? Do you want to expose your child to STEM-related fields without sacrificing their creativity and imagination? If so, coding might be the perfect opportunity for both of you.
Coding is an excellent skill to introduce your child to at an early age. It challenges them creatively and forces them to think critically. Additionally, it opens up a multitude of potential career opportunities in some of the fastest-growing fields, including robotics, artificial intelligence, and data analysis.
Coding falls within the scope of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) because it involves working with codes or sets of instructions that computers can read and understand.
If you\u2019re ready to learn more about how coding can help your kid grow as a person and as a future adult\u2014as well as why it\u2019s important for kids\u2014read on!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you think of an application, it usually means a program with some specific functionality that\u2019s usually stand-alone or something that needs to be accessed by multiple users simultaneously. In programming terms, these are generally referred to as \u201Cdesktop applications\u201D and are not commonly built using the same frameworks used for websites or mobile applications. However, when it comes to creating an application with Spring MVC, the options are virtually limitless.
In this blog post we will take a look at various examples of Spring MVC applications. These can range from simple tutorials on building your own stand-alone desktop applications with Spring Boot or extending existing web apps with some custom logic and functionality that\u2019s only available through an extension or plugin.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Now that the world of game development is becoming increasingly more digital, there are also new challenges to face. Game developers are now expected to come up with solutions to complex problems in record time. And this is where programming languages come in. They make it possible for developers to solve problems by creating programs directly instead of writing instructions word-by-word. There are numerous programming languages out there but one that has become particularly useful for game development is Go. It has many features that make it an excellent choice for developing video games, including its simplicity, type inference, and great support for Unicode. If you\u2019re looking to start learning about Go and its benefits for game development then keep reading. In this blog post, we\u2019ll be covering all you need to know about Go and why it\u2019s a great language for game development"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you think of classes and objects, what comes to mind? If your thoughts immediately went to the idea of parent and child classes, then you\u2019ve either studied object-oriented programming or you understand the nuances of English. However, if you think about a parent giving birth to a child, then you obviously haven\u2019t studied enough OOP. Let\u2019s see what inheritance in Java is all about and why it\u2019s useful.
We often find ourselves reusing code that has been implemented in some other class. This leads us to ask a very logical question \u2013 can we reuse code even further? The answer is yes! We can take one class and make it so that it extends the functionality of another. This is called inheritance in Java. It is one of the cornerstones of OOP programming and something that every serious programmer should know well.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re reading this article, I assume that you have some programming experience and are interested in expanding your knowledge of the Go programming language. You might already know some other languages or have experience with concurrency so you probably are wondering how does the Go programming language help with concurrent programming.
If you are just getting started with Go, it might feel like a steep learning curve if you\u2019ve never used its features before. However, as soon as you learn about channels and see how easy it is to implement them, things start making much more sense. Concurrent programming is an extremely complex topic that requires careful planning to avoid race conditions and deadlocks. Fortunately, Go offers a set of standard library packages for concurrent tasks so that developers can focus on writing code instead of reinventing the wheel every time they create a new project. Let\u2019s take a closer look at why we need concurrent programs and what Go has to offer in this regard.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
